column5: The Society for Psychical Research (SPR) is a non-profit organization based in London, founded in 1882 to conduct scholarly and scientific research into human experiences that challenge contemporary scientific models, such as telepathy, clairvoyance, and apparitions. It was the first organization of its kind dedicated to this purpose.

The International Metapsychic Institute, founded in 1919, conducts scientific research on telepathy, clairvoyance, precognition, and psychokinesis. It promotes an unbiased, rigorous approach to paranormal studies for researchers, officials, and the public.

column3: Institute for Frontier Areas of Psychology and Mental Health
column5: The IGPP, founded in 1950 by Hans Bender, conducts interdisciplinary research on poorly understood frontier phenomena such as exceptional experiences and altered states of consciousness. It also offers public counseling, an information service, and maintains major archives and libraries for parapsychology and related fields.
